channel.title: Always good to have: Polysynth
channel.description: Hi folks. Wanted to share my simple virtual analogue polysynth patch which - as I think - comes always handy. This patch offers three mixable waveforms (tri, saw, square with pwm), a square wave sub-oscillator, blendable low-pass/high-pass filters with filter envelope modulation (positive and negative) and - for fatness - a chorus at the end. I tried to design the patch as tweakable as possible. The MIDI CC mappings are for my Edirol controller keyboard, but you can change all the CC numbers to match your setup. I really like the fat sound little Axoloti can accomplish with such a simple patch! Spent several Vangeliesque moments with that... hope you like it! Peter petsynth.axp (17.6 KB)

item.description:
@sovietpop wrote:

Thanks for the patch !
Me too i really like the raw sound of Axoloti even with simple building block like osc - filters env etc.
I was surprise by the sound with just a simple saw osc going to an lpf .

item.title: Always good to have: Polysynth
item.dc:creator: @cpwitz Peter Witzel
item.description:
@cpwitz wrote:

Hi folks.

Wanted to share my simple virtual analogue polysynth patch which - as I think - comes always handy. This patch offers three mixable waveforms (tri, saw, square with pwm), a square wave sub-oscillator, blendable low-pass/high-pass filters with filter envelope modulation (positive and negative) and - for fatness - a chorus at the end.

I tried to design the patch as tweakable as possible. The MIDI CC mappings are for my Edirol controller keyboard, but you can change all the CC numbers to match your setup.

I really like the fat sound little Axoloti can accomplish with such a simple patch! Spent several Vangeliesque moments with that... hope you like it!

Peter
petsynth.axp (17.6 KB)
